narration_steps.narration_text: This paper, titled 'Determine Interaction Affinity Changes of the SUMO E1 Activating Enzymes', investigates the kinetics of SUMOylation.
The abstract explains that the goal was to measure the interaction dissociation constant, or Kd, between Aos1 and Uba2 during SUMO activation using a quantitative FRET assay.
Figure 1A provides a schematic of the entire SUMOylation cycle, showing how SUMO is activated, conjugated to a substrate, and then removed to start the cycle again.
Figure 1B illustrates the FRET-based assay itself, showing how the fluorescent proteins CyPet and YPet are fused to Aos1 and Uba2 to detect their interaction.
Finally, looking at Figure 4C, we can see the determined Kd values at different concentrations, which were found to be consistent and reliable, validating the FRET-based approach.
